summary: Completed testing of Scoring page list-first UI with tabs, Initiate Scoring dialog, Epic detail view with MoSCoW/RICE badges, and Epic Review page integration. Backend: 23/23 tests passed (100%). Frontend: All UI components working correctly.

backend: GET /api/scoring/options - Returns MoSCoW and RICE options
GET /api/scoring/scored-items - Items have correct structure (item_id, item_type, title)
GET /api/scoring/items-for-scoring - Returns available items (epics, standalone_stories, standalone_bugs)
GET /api/scoring/epic/{epic_id}/scores - Returns epic scores with features, stories, bugs
GET /api/scoring/epic/{epic_id}/scores - Features have MoSCoW and RICE fields
PUT /api/scoring/feature/{feature_id}/rice - Updates feature RICE and calculates total
PUT /api/scoring/story/{story_id}/rice - Updates story RICE and calculates total
Feature score persistence - Scores persist after update
frontend: Scoring page loads at /scoring
Page title 'Scoring' with description displayed
Stats cards show counts (Scored Epics, Scored Stories, Scored Bugs, Total Scored)
Tabs display correctly (Epics, Standalone Stories, Standalone Bugs)
Epic card shows title, description, and children scored count
Initiate Scoring button opens dialog
Initiate Scoring dialog has item type select (Epic/Story/Bug)
Initiate Scoring dialog has item select dropdown
Initiate Scoring dialog shows scoring info (Epic: MoSCoW, Features: MoSCoW+RICE, Stories: RICE, Bugs: RICE)
Start AI Scoring button in dialog
Clicking epic card opens detail view
Detail view shows epic title and 'Epic Scoring Details'
Detail view shows Epic Priority section with MoSCoW badge
Detail view shows Features section with MoSCoW + RICE badges
Detail view shows User Stories section with RICE only badges
AI Score All button in detail view
Back to list button works
Epic Review page shows Scoring button in Epic Details card
Scoring button navigates to /scoring?epic={epic_id}
URL with epic parameter auto-opens detail view
Epic Review page shows MoSCoW badges on features (Must Have, Should Have)
Epic Review page shows RICE badges on features (RICE: 4.0, RICE: 4.3)

critical_code_review_comments: Scoring API endpoints are well-structured with proper authentication
RICE calculation is correct: (Reach × Impact × Confidence) / Effort
MoSCoW validation properly rejects invalid scores
Frontend correctly displays MoSCoW and RICE badges with appropriate colors
Deep-linking from Epic Review to Scoring page works correctly with epic context
seed_data_creation: Updated feature and story RICE scores during testing (feat_bacd169c, story_f778c70c)
context_for_next_testing_agent: Scoring page is fully functional with list-first UI. Test epic 'epic_fbba5b78' (Pharmacy Text Connect) has 5 features and 7 stories. Features have MoSCoW scores (must_have, should_have) and some have RICE scores. AI scoring requires OpenAI API key configured in Settings.

mocked_apis.note: NO MOCKED APIs - All APIs use real backend
